abstract: Starbucks reports first-quarter profit of $464.9 million, or 33 cents a share, up 15.9 percent from $427 million, or 28 cent per share in year-earlier period; Dunkin' Brands reports earnings of $35.6 million, or 40 cents per share, up from $23 million, or 33 cents per share one year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Starbucks said comparable sales were up by more than 5 percent for the 21st consecutive quarter. Dunkin’ Brands credited new products like the croissant doughnut.

headline.main: Sales and Profit Rise for Starbucks and Dunkin’ Brands
headline.print_headline: Sales and Profits Rise for Starbucks and Dunkin’ Brands

snippet: Starbucks said comparable sales were up by more than 5 percent for the 21st consecutive quarter. Dunkin’ Brands credited new products like the croissant doughnut.
